definitions.definition: To hit or strike violently and repeatedly .
examples: The firemen battered down the door.

definitions.definition: ( cooking ) To coat with batter (the food ingredient).
examples: I prefer it when they batter the cod with breadcrumbs.

definitions.definition: ( figurative ) To defeat soundly ; to thrash .
( UK , slang , usually in the passive ) To intoxicate .
examples: I was battered last night on our pub crawl.

definitions.definition: ( metalworking ) To flatten ( metal ) by hammering , so as to compress it inwardly and spread it outwardly .
( UK , obsolete ) To coat in a paste-like substance; to fasten with a paste-like glue.

main_definition: To hit or strike violently and repeatedly .
secondary_definitions: ( cooking ) To coat with batter (the food ingredient).
( figurative ) To defeat soundly ; to thrash .
( UK , slang , usually in the passive ) To intoxicate .
( metalworking ) To flatten ( metal ) by hammering , so as to compress it inwardly and spread it outwardly .
( UK , obsolete ) To coat in a paste-like substance; to fasten with a paste-like glue.

main_definition: ( architecture ) To slope (of walls, buildings etc.).
